page.title: 03Pilot Officer Barton V.C.
page.content: Recently there has been a great deal of controversy as to whether or not there should be a plaque fixed on the {War Memorial}in Ryhope village in honour of{Pilot Officer Barton}who was posthumously awarded the{Victoria {Cross}for avoiding crashing on houses in Ryhope during the{Second World War. While on a bombing raid to Germany his plane was attacked and damaged by German fighters.{Barton}decided to carry on with the bombing even though he had lost his navigational team. He released the bombs himself. Crossing the coast near Ryhope on his return an engine failed. If he had abandoned the plane it would have crashed onto the houses below so he stayed at the controls and managed to crash-land the aircraft. He succeeded in avoiding the houses but unfortunately he lost his life. Three of his crew survived.
